intro: Pilogyne ecklonii, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Pilogyne ecklonii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
